Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open code with locale DE, open debug viewlet
2. "All Exceptions", "Uncaught Exceptions" are not translated
3. A watch expression that can't be evaluated shows an untranslated: "not available"

data.title: Explorer if we should pre-seed TS typings with the tsserver

Currently typings are fetch from npm. We shouldexplore the option to pre-seed a set of typings with the tsserver to avoid npm requests.

data.title: Adapt TSServer 2.1.x
data.body: - VSCode Version: 1.8.x

data.title: Align git command palette interaction with command line
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.7

Intuitively I'd expect `git branch -d some_name` to allow me to delete a branch. Other subcommands could be supported the same way, for some the completion item might tell you what it does (like when creating a branch), for others it's fine if it doesn't.

I like how it supports creating a new branch by assuming an unknown name after `git checkout` is a branch to be created. That could be kept almost the same, except the completion item would tell you that it will insert the `-b` option for you.

data.title: Create a "TypeHierarchyProvider" api for visualising type hierarchies
data.body:
(Split from #15485)

Dart Code has had requests for viewing/navigating [type hierarchies](https://github.com/Dart-Code/Dart-Code/issues/133). We've [implemented](https://github.com/Dart-Code/Dart-Code/pull/190) this for now using the pick-list, but we had to make compromises to fit it into a flat list.

Some other editors have this functionality and it's a concept that's not specific to Dart, so it might make sense as a provider that can be implemented by extensions.

Here's an image of it in another editor and also how we've managed to implement it currently.

![687474703a2f2f68656c702e65636c697073652e6f72672f6e656f6e2f746f7069632f6f72672e65636c697073652e6a64742e646f632e757365722f67657474](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1078012/20324242/b2c545f0-ab77-11e6-9cbb-f107c940a09c.png)
![c26454f6-8e17-11e6-9df1-046930178341](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1078012/20324241/b2c55da6-ab77-11e6-8c1d-423c903e8b43.png)

data.title: matching bracktes and quotes auto replace
data.body:
Hi,

Here’s a feature request for a thing that I alwys want to have, and I think that may be part of the auto creation of the closed brackets.
It's really coll that when I open a brcket or quotes auto appear its closing pair. but wat I want is taht I cant change the created/auto created bracket by another even if there is code/text in betwen them, without having to jumpe to its matching pair.

some usages example for a exa mple turn python list into a generator or set comprehensions
```python
list_ = [x for x in rage(5)]  # -> list
gen_ = (x for x in rage(5))  # -> generator
set_ = {x for x in rage(5)}  # -> generator
```
or a quoted example:
```
"The quick brown fox jumps over the lazy dog" -> double cuotes
'The quick brown fox jumps over the lazy dog' -> single cuotes
```

data.title: vscode configuring new shell to open in the current project directory
data.body:
Hi i´m trying to reconfigure the terminal of my vscode proyect to use a terminal provided by a .bat script that works like this:

`shell.bat CHANGE_PATH <path where the shell open>`

and I configure my tterminal like this

```
{
    "terminal.integrated.shell.windows": "<path to shell.bat>",
    "terminal.integrated.shellArgs.windows": ["CHANGE_PATH","${workspaceRoot}"]
}
```

but the ${workspaceRoot} variable did't work and the shell is opened on its default path

data.title: Code asks for git credentials even with a credential helper set up
data.body:
Constantly getting popups asking for my login. I don't want to turn off fetch.

I've got credential caching turned enabled in the Git's credential-helper. It doesn't make any difference. I get a modal dialog box asking for my credentials every few minutes.

On top of that, the dialog box doesn't scale to my 4k display, so it's really tiny (as in unreadable) with Xmonad and steals focus from whatever application I'm in.

Googling for answers doesn't provide Visual Studio Code help, just random internet advice that may be for Linux or may be for Windows with ptty.

Really it's pretty bad. At least put up a help page and get it ranked.

- VSCode Version: Code 1.7.1 (02611b40b24c9df2726ad8b33f5ef5f67ac30b44, 2016-11-03T13:46:46.244Z)
- OS Version: Linux x64 4.4.0-47-generic
- Extensions:

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|vscode-emacs|hiro-sun|0.1.1|

---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Install Visual Studio Code
2. Start it in a repository under Git version control with a remote source
3. Type in password for SSH key
4. Repeat a few minutes later
5. Repeat a few minutes later
6. Google for a solution
7. Try solution
8. Type in password
9. Try restarting VS Code
10. Type in password
11. Type in password
12. GOTO 6

data.title: curl latest deb file
data.body:
This is not a bug but more a question of how to download the latest deb file via command line in Linux. I have tried the following but it downloads the html file and not the file itself

```
# curl -o code.deb http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=760868 
```

I want to do this as I have a setup script that I run when I setup my linux environment. Thanks

data.title: Hot Exit Does not Open Unsaved File on Launch
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.8.0-Insider
- OS Version: Windows 10 x64

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open multiple files
2.  Create new unsaved file
3. Type in mumbo jumbo
4. Close VSCode (hot exit)
5. Open VSCode

You will notice that your mumbo jumbo tab is not the tab that is it focus (it seems like there is a delay for opening hot exit'ed files?).

I can make a video if instructions are unclear.

data.title: Feature Requet: Open git integration for usage from commands-api
data.body:
Please make the git integration resuable by the [commands-api](https://code.visualstudio.com/docs/extensionAPI/vscode-api-commands).

It is really cumbersome to reimplement that parts and as well the UI gets kind of laggy. Since when I checkout a branch (in my case a [github pull request](https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=KnisterPeter.vscode-github)) it needs a few seconds until the 'current branch' status entry updates.

data.title: Feature Request: Button to clear old errors and warnings output
data.body:
It would be very helpful to have a button to clear all the errors generated by linters. I leave VSCode running on a project for weeks and sometimes linters give errors or warnings that can't be fixed at the moment and clutter the error and warning panel when I'm trying to debug other packages in the project. 

Some linters also do weird things like lint Untitled files where I'm temporarily storing some text. These errors/warnings end up create an output for a random number file.  For example, I have 6 errors for file `1270 /`, and i can't remove that text until I close VSCode.

Thank you.

data.title: [ts] Property 'indexOf' does not exist on type 'string'
data.body:
- VSCode Version:1.7.1
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open a typescript file in the editor
2. I see errors on string methods

```
[ts] Property 'indexOf' does not exist on type 'string'
[ts] Property 'substring' does not exist on type 'string'
[ts] Property 'lastIndexOf' does not exist on type 'string'

```
Any thoughts?

Thx

data.title: Node debug gives stale variables if evaluation happened
data.body:
1. Debug the following program
```javascript
var text = "some text";
debugger;
```
2. In repl or watch expressions do `text = "new value"`
3. Notice how the variables view shows a stale value for `text` - VSCode is sending a `variables` request but the node debug is responding with stale results

Also happening for node2 @roblourens 
We would need to drop all cached variables on evaluation request, though not sure how expensive that is.

data.title: Wrong order of sorting line ascending
IBackupFileService: less IO?
data.body:
I wonder if the `IBackupFileService` could do less IO and read more out of memory. My understanding is that only one process will write to the backup files overall because we can only open one window per workspace. As such why not read the data into memory and have sync methods to get information about backups?

One thing you can always avoid is to check if a file exists. Just read it and handle the error case (e.g. https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/blob/master/src/vs/workbench/services/backup/node/backupFileService.ts#L92

data.title: Backups are stored with user configured encoding
data.body:
I noticed in https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/blob/master/src/vs/workbench/services/backup/node/backupFileService.ts#L73 you are not passing any encoding. This means backups are potentially stored with a user choice of encoding which is not good because we should assume UTF-8 when reading backups.

I suggest to be consistent and use UTF-8 for reading and writing of all backups.

data.title: API to determine whether a TextEditor is a diff view

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
Feature request: API support to determine if a document is open in a diff-editor. In particular, I want my extension to apply styles and provide certain language features when a document is loaded in a TextEditor, but not when its only editor is a diff-editor.

Looking at vscode.window.visibleTextEditors and vscode.workspace.textDocuments, I can't see any way to tell the difference.
